content: Where are the cries of "Give it up Norm" or "Sore Loser" that we heard during Bush/Gore? Norm has lost TWICE, but is going to pursue this? Come on Norm, we'll let you keep the stapler. Franken's lead grows, Coleman to appeal Democrat Al Franken extended his lead over Republican Norm Coleman in Minnesota's U.S. Senate election today after about 350 formerly rejected absentee ballots were counted. The Minneapolis Star Tribune reports that Franken captured 198 of the ballots, while Coleman took 111. The ballots added 87 votes to Franken’s recount lead, enlarging his margin over Coleman to 312. "http://blogs.usatoday.com/ondeadline/2009/04/frankens-lead-grows-coleman-to-appeal.html"
reply: Where are the cries of "Give it up Norm" or "Sore Loser" that we heard during Bush/Gore? Norm has lost TWICE, but is going to pursue this? Come on Norm, we'll let you keep the stapler. In democtratic enclaves the election workers counted these botched ballots. Colemen is not being allowed to go back and add the votes from "his" districts that were rejected. Two different standards of counting ballots were used. Coleman wants one standard to apply to the votes. Either way it doesn't really matter if there is one standard used.
